FuncDef: The undo ip route-static command deletes an IPv4 unicast static route. The undo ip route-static command deletes an IPv4 unicast static route. By default, the system does not configure IPv4 unicast static routes.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies a destination IP address.
The value is in dotted decimal notation.

Specifies the mask of the IP address.
The value is in dotted decimal notation.

Specifies a mask length. The 1s in each 32-bit mask must be consecutive. Therefore, a mask in dotted decimal notation can be presented by a mask length.
The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 32.

Specifies the next hop IP address of a route.
The value is in dotted decimal notation.

Specifies the type of an interface.
-

Specifies the number of an interface.
-

ExtraInfo:
On a simple network, static routes alone can ensure that the network runs properly. If the Device cannot run dynamic routing protocols to generate routes to the destination, configure static routes on the Device.
You can configure description description-text to configure a description for static routes so that the administrator can check and maintain static routes easily. To check the configured description, run the display this or display current-configuration command in the system view.
